2022-07-25.name: EAA AirVenture
2022-07-25.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2022-07-25.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-25.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-26.name: EAA AirVenture
2022-07-26.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2022-07-28.name: EAA AirVenture
2022-07-28.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2022-07-28.name: Lumberjack World Championships
2022-07-28.summary: You can't see this kind of thing just anywhere: cut-throat log rolling, boom running, springboard chopping and             speed climbing.

2022-07-28.name: Nordic Fest
2022-07-28.summary: This friendly, authentic and very large festival of Scandinavian culture features a Viking encampment, kids' games, artisan demonstrations, lutefisk-eating and Nordic rock-throwing contests and a big parade at 10:30 a.m. Saturday

2022-07-28.name: Lollapalooza
2022-07-28.summary: This big music festival features dozens of bands and, unlike other Grant Park festivals, is not free. Reserve rooms far in advance.

2022-07-28.name: Sweet Corn Days
2022-07-28.summary: In addition to free sweet corn, there will be Friday fireworks, a doughnut-hole eating contest, a kiddie tractor pull, carnival rides and a parade Saturday.

2022-07-28.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-28.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-29.name: Lumberjack World Championships
2022-07-29.summary: You can't see this kind of thing just anywhere: cut-throat log rolling, boom running, springboard chopping and             speed climbing.

2022-07-29.name: Nordic Fest
2022-07-29.summary: This friendly, authentic and very large festival of Scandinavian culture features a Viking encampment, kids' games, artisan demonstrations, lutefisk-eating and Nordic rock-throwing contests and a big parade at 10:30 a.m. Saturday

2022-07-29.name: Lollapalooza
2022-07-29.summary: This big music festival features dozens of bands and, unlike other Grant Park festivals, is not free. Reserve rooms far in advance.

2022-07-29.name: Sweet Corn Days
2022-07-29.summary: In addition to free sweet corn, there will be Friday fireworks, a doughnut-hole eating contest, a kiddie tractor pull, carnival rides and a parade Saturday.

2022-07-29.name: Pierogi Fest
2022-07-29.summary: This suburb of Chicago exalts the plump Eastern European dumplings, filled with cheese, mashed potatoes or             sauerkraut, with pierogi-eating and -tossing contests, a Mr. Pierogi songfest and a Polka Parade.

2022-07-29.name: National Balloon Classic
2022-07-29.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2022-07-29.name: German Fest
2022-07-29.summary: Look for dachshunds, dirndls and lots of oompah music at this big party at Henry Maier Festival Park on Lake Michigan.

2022-07-29.name: Taste of Wisconsin
2022-07-29.summary: This free harborfront festival features locally produced specialties as well as cooking demonstrations, gardening workshops and music on three stages.

2022-07-29.name: Coast Guard Festival
2022-07-29.summary: There's nightly entertainment on the waterfront, a downtown carnival, tours of Coast Guard cutters, a Grand Parade and fireworks.

2022-07-29.name: Prairie Dog Blues Festival
2022-07-29.summary: This Mississippi River festival on historic St. Feriole Island features 12 bands on two stages, with onsite camping.

2022-07-29.name: Blueberry Festival
2022-07-29.summary: Eat blueberry pizza and drink blueberry beer while listening to live music and watching dancers and medieval armored combat. There are also pony rides and games for kids.

2022-07-29.name: Waterama
2022-07-29.summary: This festival on the shores of Lake Minnewaska is famous for its lighted pontoon parade on Saturday, followed by fireworks. On Sunday, there's a parade on land, followed by a water-ski show.

2022-07-29.name: Riverboat Days
2022-07-29.summary: This Mississippi River town celebrates with a pedal tractor pull, duck derby, firemen's water fight and parade.

2022-07-29.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-29.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-30.name: Cardboard Cup Regatta
2022-07-30.summary: Watch or enter the cardboard-boat races on Main Beach, where prizes are awarded in many categories.

2022-07-30.summary: Reenactors, musicians and artisans bring back the fur-trade era with cannon-firing, puppet shows, storytelling and games.

2022-07-31.summary: This Manitoba prairie town celebrates its heritage with pavilions representing 44 nationalities, offering             music, dance and food at many venues.

2022-07-31.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-02.name: National Cherry Festival
2022-07-02.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2022-07-02.name: Summerfest
2022-07-02.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2022-07-02.name: Riverfest
2022-07-02.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers.

2022-07-02.name: Petunia Festival
2022-07-02.summary: This festival in the Hometown of Ronald Reagan features music, a carnival, fireworks and a parade.

2022-07-02.name: National Women's Music Festival
2022-07-02.summary: In addition to concerts, this musical and cultural festival at the Marriott Madison West features comedy, theater, film and writers' workshops.

2022-07-02.name: Catfish River Music Festival
2022-07-02.summary: More than 20 bands perform in Rotary Park during this free festival, which includes artisans, food, beer, wine and fireworks.

2022-07-02.name: Riverfront Rendezvous
2022-07-02.summary: There will be lumberjack and magic shows, bands, kids' games, a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2022-07-02.name: Iowa City Jazz Festival
2022-07-02.summary: This downtown festival features a Culinary Row, Fun Zone for kids and  fireworks in addition to music.

2022-07-02.name: Oneida Pow-Wow
2022-07-02.summary: This free family festival near Green Bay features dancing, singing, drumming, indigenous foods and crafts and lacrosse exhibitions.

2022-07-02.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-02.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-03.name: Riverfest
2022-07-03.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers.

2022-07-03.name: Sub Fest
2022-07-03.summary: The fest at the Wisconsin Maritime Museum, home of the USS Cobia, features music and a lighted boat parade on Sunday and a parade, music and fireworks on the Fourth.

2022-07-03.summary: This festival in the Hometown of Ronald Reagan features music, a carnival, fireworks and a parade.

2022-07-03.summary: In addition to concerts, this musical and cultural festival at the Marriott Madison West features comedy, theater, film and writers' workshops.

2022-07-04.name: Fire Over the Fox
2022-07-04.summary: Green Bay hosts the largest fireworks show north of Milwaukee, plus carnival rides, music and family entertainment on five stages plus the Neville Public Museum. It's in Leicht Memorial Park.

2022-07-04.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-04.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-06.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2022-07-06.name: Karl Oskar Days
2022-07-06.summary: The festival in this Swedish town just north of the Twin Cities features fireworks, a car show, children's activities and a parade.

2022-07-06.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-06.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-07.name: National Cherry Festival
2022-07-07.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2022-07-07.name: Karl Oskar Days
2022-07-07.summary: The festival in this Swedish town just north of the Twin Cities features fireworks, a car show, children's activities and a parade.

2022-07-07.name: Winnipeg Folk Festival
2022-07-07.summary: This easy-going,  family-friendly festival features more than 70 performers from eight countries, food and hand-made art  from around the world plus a fun play area for children.

2022-07-07.name: Heart of the North Rodeo
2022-07-07.summary: Look for the four R's in this western Wisconsin town: roping, bull riding, steer             wrestling and barrel racing. A parade is on Saturday.

2022-07-07.name: Summerfest
2022-07-07.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2022-07-07.name: Iola Car Show
2022-07-07.summary: This show and swap meet brings up to 130,000 people to this village east of Stevens Point.

2022-07-07.name: Hodag Country Festival
2022-07-07.summary: This year, performers at this big fest include Neal McCoy, Jon Pardi, Kip Moore and Sam Hunt. There's a band contest, too.

2022-07-07.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-07.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-08.name: National Cherry Festival
2022-07-08.summary: This town on Lake Michigan attracts half a million people to events that  include air shows, an arts fair, music, races, the big Cherry Royale Parade and many contests,  including pie-eating and pit-spitting.

2022-07-08.name: Karl Oskar Days
2022-07-08.summary: The festival in this Swedish town just north of the Twin Cities features fireworks, a car show, children's activities and a parade.

2022-07-08.name: Winnipeg Folk Festival
2022-07-08.summary: This easy-going,  family-friendly festival features more than 70 performers from eight countries, food and hand-made art  from around the world plus a fun play area for children.

2022-07-08.name: Heart of the North Rodeo
2022-07-08.summary: Look for the four R's in this western Wisconsin town: roping, bull riding, steer             wrestling and barrel racing. A parade is on Saturday.

2022-07-08.name: Summerfest
2022-07-08.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2022-07-08.name: Iola Car Show
2022-07-08.summary: This show and swap meet brings up to 130,000 people to this village east of Stevens Point.

2022-07-08.name: Hodag Country Festival
2022-07-08.summary: This year, performers at this big fest include Neal McCoy, Jon Pardi, Kip Moore and Sam Hunt. There's a band contest, too.

2022-07-08.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2022-07-08.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2022-07-08.name: Taste of Chicago
2022-07-08.summary: This year, the city offers a "bite-size'' version of its big food and music festival in Grant Park, plus three pop-up festivals in neighborhoods on the last three Saturdays in June.

2022-07-08.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2022-07-08.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 86th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2022-07-08.name: 80/35 Music Festival
2022-07-08.summary: This indie and jam music festival (named for the junction of two interstates) is at Western Gateway Park.

2022-07-08.name: Blissfest
2022-07-08.summary: This family-friendly folk and roots festival on a farm includes reggae, country, zydeco, jazz and Celtic music on three stages and four workshop areas. There's also a juried arts and crafts fair. Rustic camping is available.

2022-07-08.name: Bigfoot Days
2022-07-08.summary: This town in Chippewa National Forest, between Walker and Grand Rapids, calls itself the Home of Bigfoot. There will be a Bigfoot Olympics, a Bigfoot-calling contest, Bigfoot storytelling, a scavenger hunt and a petting zoo.

2022-07-08.name: Taste and Glow Balloon Fest
2022-07-08.summary: This festival features hot-air balloons and also music, kids' activities, craft and flea markets and sampling at Taste of Marathon County.

2022-07-08.name: Square Roots Festival
2022-07-08.summary: The Old Town School of Folk Music presents this Lincoln Square festival, which includes more than 70 acts on four stages plus 30 local and regional craft beers and food from neighborhood restaurants.

2022-07-08.name: Wild Rice Festival
2022-07-08.summary: This northern town near Grand Rapids offers a powwow Friday, wild-rice lunch, bike rodeo, sawdust scramble, singing competition and fireworks Saturday and a parade Sunday.

2022-07-08.name: Fiesta Days
2022-07-08.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival, beach bash, car show and fireworks in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a 1:30 p.m. Sunday  parade on Main Street.

2022-07-08.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-08.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-09.name: Taste and Glow Balloon Fest
2022-07-09.summary: This festival features hot-air balloons and also music, kids' activities, craft and flea markets and sampling at Taste of Marathon County.

2022-07-09.name: Phelps Mill Festival
2022-07-09.summary: There's a juried arts and crafts fair, children's activities and music in this bucolic, tucked-away park along the Otter Tail River, next to an 1889 brick and clapboard mill that's open for tours.

2022-07-09.name: Art Fair On the Square
2022-07-09.summary: Nearly 500 artists from around the nation will be selling on Capitol Square and 140 Wisconsin artists around Monona Terrace, attracting more than 200,000 people.

2022-07-09.name: Grand Marais Arts Festival
2022-07-09.summary: This juried art show along the Lake Superior harbor includes children's activities, art demonstrations, a pie social and live music.

2022-07-09.name: Driftless Music Festival
2022-07-09.summary: This free folk and roots festival is in Viroqua's Eckhart Park.

2022-07-09.name: Square Roots Festival
2022-07-09.summary: The Old Town School of Folk Music presents this Lincoln Square festival, which includes more than 70 acts on four stages plus 30 local and regional craft beers and food from neighborhood restaurants.

2022-07-09.name: Wild Rice Festival
2022-07-09.summary: This northern town near Grand Rapids offers a powwow Friday, wild-rice lunch, bike rodeo, sawdust scramble, singing competition and fireworks Saturday and a parade Sunday.

2022-07-09.name: Fiesta Days
2022-07-09.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival, beach bash, car show and fireworks in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a 1:30 p.m. Sunday  parade on Main Street.

2022-07-09.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-09.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-10.name: Karl Oskar Days
2022-07-10.summary: The festival in this Swedish town just north of the Twin Cities features fireworks, a car show, children's activities and a parade.

2022-07-10.name: Winnipeg Folk Festival
2022-07-10.summary: This easy-going,  family-friendly festival features more than 70 performers from eight countries, food and hand-made art  from around the world plus a fun play area for children.

2022-07-10.name: Hodag Country Festival
2022-07-10.summary: This year, performers at this big fest include Neal McCoy, Jon Pardi, Kip Moore and Sam Hunt. There's a band contest, too.

2022-07-10.name: Taste of Chicago
2022-07-10.summary: This year, the city offers a "bite-size'' version of its big food and music festival in Grant Park, plus three pop-up festivals in neighborhoods on the last three Saturdays in June.

2022-07-10.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2022-07-10.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 86th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2022-07-10.name: Blissfest
2022-07-10.summary: This family-friendly folk and roots festival on a farm includes reggae, country, zydeco, jazz and Celtic music on three stages and four workshop areas. There's also a juried arts and crafts fair. Rustic camping is available.

2022-07-10.name: Taste and Glow Balloon Fest
2022-07-10.summary: This festival features hot-air balloons and also music, kids' activities, craft and flea markets and sampling at Taste of Marathon County.

2022-07-10.name: Phelps Mill Festival
2022-07-10.summary: There's a juried arts and crafts fair, children's activities and music in this bucolic, tucked-away park along the Otter Tail River, next to an 1889 brick and clapboard mill that's open for tours.

2022-07-10.name: Art Fair On the Square
2022-07-10.summary: Nearly 500 artists from around the nation will be selling on Capitol Square and 140 Wisconsin artists around Monona Terrace, attracting more than 200,000 people.

2022-07-10.name: Grand Marais Arts Festival
2022-07-10.summary: This juried art show along the Lake Superior harbor includes children's activities, art demonstrations, a pie social and live music.

2022-07-10.name: Square Roots Festival
2022-07-10.summary: The Old Town School of Folk Music presents this Lincoln Square festival, which includes more than 70 acts on four stages plus 30 local and regional craft beers and food from neighborhood restaurants.

2022-07-10.name: Wild Rice Festival
2022-07-10.summary: This northern town near Grand Rapids offers a powwow Friday, wild-rice lunch, bike rodeo, sawdust scramble, singing competition and fireworks Saturday and a parade Sunday.

2022-07-10.name: Fiesta Days
2022-07-10.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival, beach bash, car show and fireworks in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a 1:30 p.m. Sunday  parade on Main Street.

2022-07-10.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-10.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-01.name: Summerfest
2022-07-01.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2022-07-01.name: Riverfest
2022-07-01.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers.

2022-07-01.name: Petunia Festival
2022-07-01.summary: This festival in the Hometown of Ronald Reagan features music, a carnival, fireworks and a parade.

2022-07-01.name: National Women's Music Festival
2022-07-01.summary: In addition to concerts, this musical and cultural festival at the Marriott Madison West features comedy, theater, film and writers' workshops.

2022-07-01.name: Catfish River Music Festival
2022-07-01.summary: More than 20 bands perform in Rotary Park during this free festival, which includes artisans, food, beer, wine and fireworks.

2022-07-01.name: Riverfront Rendezvous
2022-07-01.summary: There will be lumberjack and magic shows, bands, kids' games, a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2022-07-01.name: Canada Day
2022-07-01.summary: On Canada Day at Fort William Historical Park, the continent's largest reconstructed fur post, admission is free to the first 500 visitors. There's also free corn on the cob, an inflatable obstacle course, axe-throwing, paintball, canoe rides, dance performances and bannock-making, log-sawing and lacrosse contests.

2022-07-01.name: Iowa City Jazz Festival
2022-07-01.summary: This downtown festival features a Culinary Row, Fun Zone for kids and  fireworks in addition to music.

2022-07-01.name: Oneida Pow-Wow
2022-07-01.summary: This free family festival near Green Bay features dancing, singing, drumming, indigenous foods and crafts and lacrosse exhibitions.

2022-07-01.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-01.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-15.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2022-07-15.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2022-07-15.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2022-07-15.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 86th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2022-07-15.name: Rock Fest
2022-07-15.summary: This outdoor festival is near Chippewa Falls.

2022-07-15.name: RiverSong Music Festival
2022-07-15.summary: This family-friendly festival on the Crow River, west of the Twin Cities, features folk, blues, jazz and other grassroots music on three stages, including one for children. There's onsite camping and food.

2022-07-15.name: Honor the Earth Pow-wow
2022-07-15.summary: The  Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa holds the 50th anniversary of one of the largest powwows in North America, with dancing, singing and crafts plus a cooking contest, run/walk and softball tournament.

2022-07-15.name: Lumberjack Days
2022-07-15.summary: This music festival along the St. Croix River also features lumberjack shows and such attractions as a downhill derby, hammerschlagen, helicopter rides and a parade.

2022-07-15.name: Wannigan Days
2022-07-15.summary: St. Croix Falls and its cross-river neighbor, Taylors Falls, pay tribute to lumberjacks and river pigs with rock and country music, an arts and crafts fair, a Saturday parade and fireworks.

2022-07-15.name: Rivertown Days
2022-07-15.summary: In this river town south of St. Paul, there will be 25 bands on four stages, plus a carnival, arts & crafts fair and classic-car show.

2022-07-15.name: Bastille Days
2022-07-15.summary: Look for minstrels, cancan dancers, French lessons, a Mardi Gras parade and a 43-foot replica of the Eiffel Tower in Cathedral Square Park.

2022-07-15.name: Riverfest
2022-07-15.summary: This Mississippi River town celebrates summer with a car show, pie-eating contest, Friday fireworks and noon parade on Sunday.

2022-07-15.name: Water Days
2022-07-15.summary: In this lakes town near Sibley State Park, there's a water-ski show, parade, kids' fishing derby and fireworks.

2022-07-15.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2022-07-15.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with such events as turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2022-07-15.name: Bavarian Blast
2022-07-15.summary: In addition to German music, food and beer, this festival at the Brown County Fair Grounds features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and sauerkraut-eating contests, plus a Sunday parade.

2022-07-15.name: Paperfest
2022-07-15.summary: This Fox Cities town celebrates its heritage with toilet-paper tosses, lawn games, concerts, human foosball and a firefighter tug of war.

2022-07-15.name: Pitchfork Music Festival
2022-07-15.summary: This indie and alt-rock festival is in Union Park.

2022-07-15.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-15.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-16.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2022-07-16.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2022-07-16.name: Northwest Water Carnival
2022-07-16.summary: This big festival  celebrates its 86th year with a sand-castle contest, water fights, ship-building (in less than 30 minutes), beer tasting,  watermelon feed, bike tour and more. On the last day, there's a big parade at 1 p.m.

2022-07-16.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2022-07-16.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2022-07-16.name: Rock Fest
2022-07-16.summary: This outdoor festival is near Chippewa Falls.

2022-07-16.name: RiverSong Music Festival
2022-07-16.summary: This family-friendly festival on the Crow River, west of the Twin Cities, features folk, blues, jazz and other grassroots music on three stages, including one for children. There's onsite camping and food.

2022-07-16.summary: The  Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa holds the 50th anniversary of one of the largest powwows in North America, with dancing, singing and crafts plus a cooking contest, run/walk and softball tournament.

2022-07-16.summary: This music festival along the St. Croix River also features lumberjack shows and such attractions as a downhill derby, hammerschlagen, helicopter rides and a parade.

2022-07-16.name: Wannigan Days
2022-07-16.summary: St. Croix Falls and its cross-river neighbor, Taylors Falls, pay tribute to lumberjacks and river pigs with rock and country music, an arts and crafts fair, a Saturday parade and fireworks.

2022-07-16.name: Rivertown Days
2022-07-16.summary: In this river town south of St. Paul, there will be 25 bands on four stages, plus a carnival, arts & crafts fair and classic-car show.

2022-07-16.name: Chinatown Summer Fair
2022-07-16.summary: There's a Lion Dance, Chinese  classical dance and music, demonstrations of martial arts and displays  of ancient art forms and disciplines plus a  petting zoo and pony rides.

2022-07-16.name: Civil War Encampment and Battle
2022-07-16.summary: This event at Old Falls Village features Lincoln's Gettysburg Address, storytelling and a soldier encampment with medical and cooking demonstration. General Grant narrates the Battle of Cedar Run, 2 p.m. both days.

2022-07-16.name: Minnesota Scottish Fair & Highland Games
2022-07-16.summary: This fest south of St. Paul features Celtic music, a British car show, a harp competition and heavy games, such as hammer throwing, sheaf tossing, caber turning and the stone put.

2022-07-16.name: Port Fish Day
2022-07-16.summary: The world's largest one-day outdoor fish fry also includes classic car and arts and crafts shows, soccer water fights, a smoked-fish eating contest, music on three stages, a parade and fireworks.

2022-07-16.name: Red Bull Flugtag
2022-07-16.summary: In goofy leaps of faith, 60 teams will launch their handcrafted flying machines off a 27-foot flight deck and into Lake Michigan at Veterans Park.

2022-07-16.name: Bastille Days
2022-07-16.summary: Look for minstrels, cancan dancers, French lessons, a Mardi Gras parade and a 43-foot replica of the Eiffel Tower in Cathedral Square Park.

2022-07-16.name: Riverfest
2022-07-16.summary: This Mississippi River town celebrates summer with a car show, pie-eating contest, Friday fireworks and noon parade on Sunday.

2022-07-16.name: Fiesta Days
2022-07-16.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival, beach bash, car show and fireworks in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a 1:30 p.m. Sunday  parade on Main Street.

2022-07-16.name: Water Days
2022-07-16.summary: In this lakes town near Sibley State Park, there's a water-ski show, parade, kids' fishing derby and fireworks.

2022-07-16.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2022-07-16.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with such events as turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2022-07-16.name: Bavarian Blast
2022-07-16.summary: In addition to German music, food and beer, this festival at the Brown County Fair Grounds features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and sauerkraut-eating contests, plus a Sunday parade.

2022-07-16.name: Paperfest
2022-07-16.summary: This Fox Cities town celebrates its heritage with toilet-paper tosses, lawn games, concerts, human foosball and a firefighter tug of war.

2022-07-16.name: Lowertown Blues & Funk Festival
2022-07-16.summary: Dual Citizen Brewing on Raymond Avenue hosts this outdoor music festival.

2022-07-16.name: Stockholm Art Fair
2022-07-16.summary: This hamlet on Lake Pepin, a favorite day trip destination for Twin Citians, becomes a shopping mecca during this big fair.

2022-07-16.name: Agate Days
2022-07-16.summary: See the beautiful stones on display, then dig for them at 3 p.m. Saturday during the Agate Stampede, when a load of rocks seeded with 400 pounds agates, $400 in quarters and $100 in 50-cent pieces is dumped downtown.

2022-07-16.name: Bayfront Reggae & World Music Festival
2022-07-16.summary: Listen to island music on the shore of Lake Superior.

2022-07-16.name: Pitchfork Music Festival
2022-07-16.summary: This indie and alt-rock festival is in Union Park.

2022-07-16.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-16.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-22.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2022-07-22.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2022-07-22.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2022-07-22.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2022-07-22.name: Festa Italiana
2022-07-22.summary: At the lakefront Henry Maier Festival Park, there's cannoli-eating and  pizza-making contests, celebrity chefs, a bocce ball tournament, parades at 5 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, nightly fireworks and music and  dance on five stages and an opera tent.

2022-07-22.name: Aquatennial
2022-07-22.summary: The City of Lakes holds a Wednesday Torchlight Parade, water-ski shows and Saturday fireworks.

2022-07-22.name: Country Jam
2022-07-22.summary: Little Big Town, Dustin Lynch and Cody Johnson are  among the headliners of this fest. There's camping on-site.

2022-07-22.name: La Crosse Storytelling Festival
2022-07-22.summary: Listen to local, regional and national storytellers spin tales at the Pump House. There will also be music and arts and crafts.

2022-07-22.name: Hiawatha Traditional Music Festival
2022-07-22.summary: This folk-music festival in Tourist Park also features a juried arts and crafts show and camping on-site.

2022-07-22.name: Muskie Days
2022-07-22.summary: The festival in this lake town on the Heartland State Trail features an inflatable obstacle course, hula-hoop instruction, a casting contest, music on three stages, kids' games, an ice cream-eating contest and a parade  Saturday.

2022-07-22.name: Great Folle Avoine Fur Trade Rendezvous
2022-07-22.summary: At this rendezvous at a rebuilt post on the banks of the Yellow River, visit with costumed traders and voyageurs from the fur-trade era and see demonstrations of tomahawk-throwing, black-powder shooting, candlemaking and other skills. There will also be a candy cannon, bead pile and kids' games.

2022-07-22.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-22.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-23.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder pageant
2022-07-23.summary: The festival in this western Minnesota town revolves around the book "On the             Banks of Plum Creek.''

2022-07-23.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2022-07-23.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2022-07-23.name: Festa Italiana
2022-07-23.summary: At the lakefront Henry Maier Festival Park, there's cannoli-eating and  pizza-making contests, celebrity chefs, a bocce ball tournament, parades at 5 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, nightly fireworks and music and  dance on five stages and an opera tent.

2022-07-23.name: Air and Water Show
2022-07-23.summary: This show, between Bradford and McKinley beaches on the lakefront, features the Blue Angels in the air and ski teams on the water.

2022-07-23.name: Wenonga Days
2022-07-23.summary: The festival in this lake-resort town near Glendalough State Park features walking tours, human foosball, turtle races, Civil War reenactors, a water-ski show and a parade at 7 p.m. Saturday, followed by a street dance and fireworks.

2022-07-23.name: Aquatennial
2022-07-23.summary: The City of Lakes holds a Wednesday Torchlight Parade, water-ski shows and Saturday fireworks.

2022-07-23.name: Country Jam
2022-07-23.summary: Little Big Town, Dustin Lynch and Cody Johnson are  among the headliners of this fest. There's camping on-site.

2022-07-23.name: La Crosse Storytelling Festival
2022-07-23.summary: Listen to local, regional and national storytellers spin tales at the Pump House. There will also be music and arts and crafts.

2022-07-23.name: Midwest Fire Fest
2022-07-23.summary: This pottery town east of Madison celebrates the arts fueled by fire, including clay, glass and metal. It includes fire dancing, music from seven bands, demonstrations and food, including wood-fired pizza. Fest-goers can design their own tiles to be created during a hot-iron pour Saturday.

2022-07-23.name: Hiawatha Traditional Music Festival
2022-07-23.summary: This folk-music festival in Tourist Park also features a juried arts and crafts show and camping on-site.

2022-07-23.name: Muskie Days
2022-07-23.summary: The festival in this lake town on the Heartland State Trail features an inflatable obstacle course, hula-hoop instruction, a casting contest, music on three stages, kids' games, an ice cream-eating contest and a parade  Saturday.

2022-07-23.name: Great Folle Avoine Fur Trade Rendezvous
2022-07-23.summary: At this rendezvous at a rebuilt post on the banks of the Yellow River, visit with costumed traders and voyageurs from the fur-trade era and see demonstrations of tomahawk-throwing, black-powder shooting, candlemaking and other skills. There will also be a candy cannon, bead pile and kids' games.

2022-07-23.name: ArtBike + ArtCar Parade
2022-07-23.summary: Decorated bikes, cars and one Couchmobile will circle Lake Harriet at 6 p.m. Everyone is welcome to bring a decorated conveyance and join the parade; meet at 5 p.m. at the Rose Garden.

2022-07-23.name: Blueberry Festival
2022-07-23.summary: This small town between Duluth and Ashland celebrates its berry harvest with a pie-eating contest, pedal tractor pull, music, fireworks and Sunday parade.

2022-07-23.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-23.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-11.summary: In this lakes town near Sibley State Park, there's a water-ski show, parade, kids' fishing derby and fireworks.

2022-07-17.name: Riverfest
2022-07-17.summary: This Mississippi River town celebrates summer with a car show, pie-eating contest, Friday fireworks and noon parade on Sunday.

2022-07-17.name: Fiesta Days
2022-07-17.summary: There's a Music Fest, carnival, beach bash, car show and fireworks in Petersen Park the first weekend. The second weekend, there's an art and street fair Saturday and a 1:30 p.m. Sunday  parade on Main Street.

2022-07-17.name: Water Days
2022-07-17.summary: In this lakes town near Sibley State Park, there's a water-ski show, parade, kids' fishing derby and fireworks.

2022-07-17.name: Sinclair Lewis Days
2022-07-17.summary: The hometown of the Nobel Prize-winning author celebrates with such events as turtle races, bicycle stunts, Friday fireworks, a craft fair, music and a parade Saturday.

2022-07-17.name: Bavarian Blast
2022-07-17.summary: In addition to German music, food and beer, this festival at the Brown County Fair Grounds features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and sauerkraut-eating contests, plus a Sunday parade.

2022-07-17.name: Paperfest
2022-07-17.summary: This Fox Cities town celebrates its heritage with toilet-paper tosses, lawn games, concerts, human foosball and a firefighter tug of war.

2022-07-17.name: Agate Days
2022-07-17.summary: See the beautiful stones on display, then dig for them at 3 p.m. Saturday during the Agate Stampede, when a load of rocks seeded with 400 pounds agates, $400 in quarters and $100 in 50-cent pieces is dumped downtown.

2022-07-17.name: Pitchfork Music Festival
2022-07-17.summary: This indie and alt-rock festival is in Union Park.

2022-07-17.name: Woodstock Folk Festival
2022-07-17.summary: Listen to music on the square in this town just over the Wisconsin border from Lake             Geneva.

2022-07-17.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-17.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-18.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2022-07-18.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2022-07-18.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-18.summary:

This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-19.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2022-07-19.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2022-07-19.summary:

This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-20.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2022-07-20.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2022-07-20.name: Aquatennial
2022-07-20.summary: The City of Lakes holds a Wednesday Torchlight Parade, water-ski shows and Saturday fireworks.

2022-07-20.name: Great Folle Avoine Fur Trade Rendezvous
2022-07-20.summary: At this rendezvous at a rebuilt post on the banks of the Yellow River, visit with costumed traders and voyageurs from the fur-trade era and see demonstrations of tomahawk-throwing, black-powder shooting, candlemaking and other skills. There will also be a candy cannon, bead pile and kids' games.

This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-21.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2022-07-21.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2022-07-21.name: Aquatennial
2022-07-21.summary: The City of Lakes holds a Wednesday Torchlight Parade, water-ski shows and Saturday fireworks.

2022-07-21.name: Country Jam
2022-07-21.summary: Little Big Town, Dustin Lynch and Cody Johnson are  among the headliners of this fest. There's camping on-site.

2022-07-21.name: Great Folle Avoine Fur Trade Rendezvous
2022-07-21.summary: At this rendezvous at a rebuilt post on the banks of the Yellow River, visit with costumed traders and voyageurs from the fur-trade era and see demonstrations of tomahawk-throwing, black-powder shooting, candlemaking and other skills. There will also be a candy cannon, bead pile and kids' games.

2022-07-21.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-21.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-07-24.name: Charlevoix Venetian Festival
2022-07-24.summary: A week of music and games winds up with an 11 a.m. street parade and, at dusk, a lighted boat parade followed by fireworks.

2022-07-24.name: Festa Italiana
2022-07-24.summary: At the lakefront Henry Maier Festival Park, there's cannoli-eating and  pizza-making contests, celebrity chefs, a bocce ball tournament, parades at 5 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, nightly fireworks and music and  dance on five stages and an opera tent.

2022-07-24.name: Air and Water Show
2022-07-24.summary: This show, between Bradford and McKinley beaches on the lakefront, features the Blue Angels in the air and ski teams on the water.

2022-07-24.name: Wenonga Days
2022-07-24.summary: The festival in this lake-resort town near Glendalough State Park features walking tours, human foosball, turtle races, Civil War reenactors, a water-ski show and a parade at 7 p.m. Saturday, followed by a street dance and fireworks.

2022-07-24.name: Midwest Fire Fest
2022-07-24.summary: This pottery town east of Madison celebrates the arts fueled by fire, including clay, glass and metal. It includes fire dancing, music from seven bands, demonstrations and food, including wood-fired pizza. Fest-goers can design their own tiles to be created during a hot-iron pour Saturday.

2022-07-24.name: Hiawatha Traditional Music Festival
2022-07-24.summary: This folk-music festival in Tourist Park also features a juried arts and crafts show and camping on-site.

2022-07-24.name: Great Folle Avoine Fur Trade Rendezvous
2022-07-24.summary: At this rendezvous at a rebuilt post on the banks of the Yellow River, visit with costumed traders and voyageurs from the fur-trade era and see demonstrations of tomahawk-throwing, black-powder shooting, candlemaking and other skills. There will also be a candy cannon, bead pile and kids' games.

2022-07-24.name: Blueberry Festival
2022-07-24.summary: This small town between Duluth and Ashland celebrates its berry harvest with a pie-eating contest, pedal tractor pull, music, fireworks and Sunday parade.

2022-07-24.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-07-24.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.
